page.title: 04BASILDON NE: OAP'S VIEW
page.content:
Having lived here nearly 30 years, the greatest change is in the attitude of people. They care less. There is little friendship or community spirit. Children are not encouraged to have respect for their parents let alone others. They, and adults, are rude and try to take advantage of us. Maybe it's because families now live over a wider area - the closeness has gone.
The council does provide various amenities for pensioners, but as there are none in this area, you need money to travel, which I haven't got. And I'd prefer that some more money was spent on housing, for improvements and for new houses for the youngsters.
I'd like to see more help from the council, for example removing garden rubbish which I can't deal with.
